NeuOsc Lite (neuosc.lite)¶

A very lite version of this package with all frequently used functions and files in one place.

Classes and Functions¶

class lite.MSW(energy)¶

MSW effect calculations

Attributes: energy: energy of the neutrino

adiabatic_p(mixing_angle, lambdahat)¶

Survival probability of adiabatic evolution

Attributes:

  • mixing_angle: The mixing angle for two flavor oscillation;
  • lambdahat: \(\hat\lambda = \lambda/\omega\) where \(\omega\) is the vacuum frequency.
solar_landau_zener_p(mixing_angle, lambdahat)¶

Survival probability with Landau Zener transition

Attributes:

  • mixing_angle: The mixing angle for two flavor oscillation;
  • lambdahat: \(\hat\lambda = \lambda/\omega\) where \(\omega\) is the vacuum frequency.
class lite.Neutrino(energy, mixing_angle, mass_difference)¶

Neutrino class which contains energy, mixing angle, mass differences and vacuum oscillation frequency.

mixing_matrix()¶

Unitary matrix that rotates the state from vacuum basis to flavor basis

omega()¶

Frequency omega of the neutrino oscillation in vacuum,

\(\omega = \Delta m^2 / 2 E\)

lite.mix2(thetav)¶

neutrino mixing matrix: from

lite.mixing2()¶

neutrino mixing matrix with : from vacuum basis to flavor basis

lite.pauli_matrices(n)¶

Pauli Matrices

Parameters

n : 0,1,2,3
specify which matrix to use. n = 0: identity n = 1: sigma_1 n = 2: sigma_2 n = 3: sigma_3

Returns

returns the corresponding Pauli matrix as a np.array()

Notes

n = 0 is identity.

Usage

  • pauli_matrices(n) is \(\sigma_n\);
  • n runs from 0 to 3, where pauli_matrices(0) is identity matrix.

Examples

>>> from neuosc.lite import *
>>> pauli_matrices(1)
>>> [[0,1.],[1,0.]]
